page.title: 18AN ANNUAL EVENT IN PENICUIK
page.content: The soldiers based at Glencorse Barracks are the Royal Scots, the Royal Highland Fusiliers, the King's Own Scottish Borderers, the Cameronians, the Black Watch and the Queen's Own Highlanders. Once a year on a Sunday in the middle of June, there is an Open Day when the public are allowed into the barracks for a look at what goes on. The army puts on different displays, e.g. mock battles, shooting demonstrations, police dogs and motor cycles. There are tanks which you can climb on top of and go inside. This year the Golden Lions gave a parachuting display. They were formed in 1969 to promote free fall parachuting in the Scottish Army. For fund raising there are side shows, pony rides and a death slide. The money made from the stalls at the Open Day goes to local charities.
